alert.note: Alert for Brazoria Islands; Coastal Brazoria; Coastal Galveston; Fort Bend; Inland Brazoria; Inland Galveston (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 10:14PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Galveston, southeastern Fort Bend and eastern Brazoria Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1011 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Houston to High Island. Movement was south at 40 mph. An outflow boundary racing ahead of these storms was pushing southwest ahead of the rain and will also be capable of producing strong winds. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Pearland, southwestern League City, Sugar Land, Missouri City, Texas City, southern Friendswood, Lake Jackson, Alvin, Angleton, Dickinson, Stafford, La Marque, Santa Fe, Freeport, Clute, Hitchcock, Manvel, Surfside Beach, First Colony and Fresno. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for southeastern Texas.

area.areaDesc: Brazoria Islands; Coastal Brazoria; Coastal Galveston; Fort Bend; Inland Brazoria; Inland Galveston
